repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

did.unittitle: Richard Henry Gregory papers
did.physloc: For current information on the location of these materials, please consult the Library's online catalog.
did.abstract: Tobacconist, of Tarboro, N.C., and employee of the British-American Tobacco Company in China, 1905-1935. Diaries and photographs from Gregory's travels in China, 1905-1906, as an employee of the British-American Tobacco Company. Includes material on travels to Shanghai, Hankow, and the provinces of Honan, Hunan, Hupeh, and Kiangsi, including descriptions of the countryside and customs, and of tobacco culture in the region.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Researchers must register and agree to copyright and privacy laws before using this collection.
All or portions of this collection may be housed off-site in Duke University's Library Service Center. The library may require up to 48 hours to retrieve these materials for research use.
Please contact Research Services staff before visiting the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library to use this collection.

userestrict.head: Copyright Notice
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], in the Richard Henry Gregory Papers, 1905-1940, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Descriptive sources and standards used to create this inventory: DACS and local Style Guide.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Richard Henry Gregory, tobacconist of Tarboro, N.C., traveled to China from 1905 to 1906 on behalf of the British-American Tobacco Company. Gregory served as head of the company's Leaf Department in China. In 1912, Gregory married Hattie B. Arrington and together the couple raised two children while living in Shanghai--John, who died during childhood diptheria, and Jane. Gregory made his home in China until his retirement in 1935.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Diaries and photographs from Gregory's travels in China, 1905-1906, as an employee of the British-American Tobacco Company. Includes material on travels to Shanghai, Hankow, and the provinces of Honan, Hunan, Hupeh, and Kiangsi, including descriptions of the countryside and customs, and of tobacco culture in the region.

archref.repository: J.Y. Joyner Library, East Carolina University

archref.unittitle: Jane Gregory Marrow Oral History Interview, January 26, 1976
archref.repository: J.Y. Joyner Library, East Carolina University
David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

did.unittitle: Diaries and Letter, 1905-1906

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Two diaries kept by Richard Henry Gregory during his travels in China, 1905-1906. Also included is a two-part typed copy of the June-August, 1906 diary that includes photographs with typed captions, and a letter from Gregory to "My Dear Katie," dated January 12, 1906.

did.unittitle: Photographs, 1905-1940

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Series includes photographs of British American Tobacco Company cigarette factories, operations, employees, and executives probably in Hankow, China.
